thread.title: Power restored to 89,000 Christchurch homes after short outage
thread.title_full: Power restored to 89,000 Christchurch homes after short outage

author: Jamie Small
title: Power restored to 89,000 Christchurch homes after short outage
text:
Power restored to 89,000 Christchurch homes after short outage JAMIE SMALL Last updated 15:09, February 15 2017 Orion 
Orion reported outages across the city. 
Power has been restored to 89,000 Christchurch households after a 30-minute outage related to the city's fires. 
Widespread power outages were reported at about 2pm after smoke or flames from the fires caused the Transpower 220 kV line to trip. Orion says it has now restored supply to all affected customers, but supply remained fragile because of the continuing fire threat. 
"Orion is closely monitoring the fire, and is ready to respond as quickly as required if our network is further affected. We will keep the public fully updated as circumstances with the fires evolve," said Orion chief executive Rob Jameson. KIRK HARGREAVES/FAIRFAX NZ 
The power was cut to suburbs across Christchurch. 
A few intersections are still flashing yellow, but work crews are attending to them now. 
Police have patrols in the city assisting those affected by the outages and reminded motorists to drive with care and observe the give-way rules. Not so used to big fires but this is starting to get unnerving and power is out over most of CHCH pic.twitter.com/BTocN0ldnK
